channel.title: How to change peoples right on Testscape base?
channel.description:
How to change peoples right on Testscape base? I have this server but when i tryed to change peoples right from 0 to like 3 or 2
It auto change it back to 0 can anyone tell me how i can change rights? ( testsacpe base)

item.title: How to change peoples right on Testscape base?

item.description:
@i_dont_care wrote:

1ce you fugure out compiler go 2 characters and whosever name you want scroll down 5 lines and chang the 1 2 a either 2 4 mod 3 4 admin

item.title: How to change peoples right on Testscape base?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

-.- No download needed. Just do what I told you. Halson if you need a better explanation on how to fix your compiler then refer to this: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,111589.msg1110362.html#msg1110362…

Read full topic
item.source: How to change peoples right on Testscape base?

item.title: How to change peoples right on Testscape base?
item.dc:creator: @MoparRocksScape MoparRocksScape
item.description:
@MoparRocksScape wrote:

[quote=“Inching Away, post:4, topic:77390”]No just tell the person who your editing rights to log out. And when your done they log back in. That simple. No need to restart.
Make a notepad file and paste Mod Taharoks ‘perfect’ compiler on it. Then save to your source file as compiler.bat.[/quote]
No, some servers you have to restart. And I tried the same thing making people log out for 20-40 seconds and no changes. I have to restart. By the way I’m sure you can find a Compiler in RS2 Server Downloads.

Read full topic
item.source: How to change peoples right on Testscape base?

item.title: How to change peoples right on Testscape base?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I do… First you open NotePad…

Then paste this into NotePad:

:: ::
:: All of the following code is © Copywrited 2006-2007, ::
:: Grene Penguin Entertainment. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
cls
:menu
title Runserver + Compiler version 1.2
echo Please choose an option below to do that function.
echo Keep posted on the Moparscape Tutorials section for
echo any updates that I post.
echo.
echo c - Compile your server.
echo r - To run your server.
echo e - To exit out of the program.
echo.
echo.
set /p compile=Option:
if %compile%==c goto compile
if %compile%==C goto compile
if %compile%==r goto run
if %compile%==R goto run
if %compile%==e goto end
if %compile%==E goto end
if %compile#==* goto error
goto error
:compile
cls
title Compiler
if defined javac (goto compile2) else (goto checkjavac)
:compile2
if exist *.java (goto compile3) else (goto compileerror)
:compile3
%javac% -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto menu
:compileerror
cls
echo You need to have Java files for this compiler to compile.
pause
cls
goto menu
:run
cls
title Runserver
if exist .server.class (goto run2) else (goto servererror)
:run2
set java=java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar
cls
goto run3
:run3
%java% server
pause
cls
goto menu
:servererror
cls
title Error
echo You do not have a Server.class. Make sure that you have used the
echo compiler with your server BEFORE you try running it.
pause
cls
goto menu
:error
cls
title Error
echo Invalid command. Please make sure the commands you type
echo in are correct.
pause
cls
goto menu
:end
cls
exit
:checkjavac
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_06injavac.exe” (goto setjavac) else (goto checkjavac2)
:checkjavac2
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_07injavac.exe” (goto setjavac2) else (goto checkjavac3)
:checkjavac3
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_08injavac.exe” (goto setjavac3) else (goto checkjavac4)
:checkjavac4
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_09injavac.exe” (goto setjavac4) else (goto checkjavac5)
:checkjavac5
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_10injavac.exe” (goto setjavac5) else (goto checkjavac6)
:checkjavac6
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.6.0injavac.exe” (goto setjavac6) else (goto checkjavac7)
:checkjavac7
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0injavac.exe” (goto setjavac7) else (goto checkjavac8)
:checkjavac8
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_01injavac.exe” (goto setjavac8) else (goto checkjavac9)
:checkjavac9
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_02injavac.exe” (goto setjavac9) else (goto checkjavac10)
:checkjavac10
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_03injavac.exe” (goto setjavac10) else (goto checkjavac11)
:checkjavac11
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_04injavac.exe” (goto setjavac11) else (goto checkjavac12)
:checkjavac12
if exist “%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_05injavac.exe” (goto setjavac12) else (goto javacerror)
:setjavac
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_06injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac2
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_07injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac3
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_08injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac4
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_09injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac5
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_10injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac6
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.6.0injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac7
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac8
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_01injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac9
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_02injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac10
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_03injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac11
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_04injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:setjavac12
set javac="%programfiles%Javajdk1.5.0_05injavac.exe"
goto compile2
:javacerror
cls
title Error
echo You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0. Go to Mod Taharok’s tutorial
echo on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for a direct link to download
echo the newest JDK Update.
pause
cls
goto menu[/code]

Save this to your source file (it might be on your desktop) as compiler.bat. Should work.

Read full topic

No just tell the person who your editing rights to log out. And when your done they log back in. That simple. No need to restart.
Make a notepad file and paste Mod Taharoks ‘perfect’ compiler on it. Then save to your source file as compiler.bat.

item.title: How to change peoples right on Testscape base?
item.dc:creator: @MoparRocksScape MoparRocksScape
item.description:
@MoparRocksScape wrote:

Okay I have the same problem, all you have to do is after you change the Player Rights, shut down the server and then Compile. Now turn server back online and it should work.

~Thanks, Mike

Read full topic
